result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:25 PM Defendant Randolph L. Fairman in court.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds the defendant indigent and appoints attorney Philip Brehm. Defendant to reimburse the County $50 per month.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Indigency hearing on September 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 3:59 PM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randolph Lee Fairman appeared by phone.  Attorney Anna Elizabeth Hartz appeared by video for Randolph Lee Fairman. Defendant pleads not guilty, jury trial to be set.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

03:42 PM Prosecuting attorney David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randolph Lee Fairman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Klobucar appeared by video for Randolph Lee Fairman. Address confirmed.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  $500.00 cash bond set with conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance August 17, 2022 at 3pm.

Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case without valid drivers license or without valid insurance.  Maintain absolute sobriety No contact directly or indirectly with victim H.P.F., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.
